phrase.cizu_name: revenge is a dish best served (或 eaten) cold

jx.jx_en_mean: (proverb)vengeance is often more satisfying if it is not exacted immediately

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French revencher, from late Latin revindicare, from re- (expressing intensive force) + vindicare 'claim, avenge'

entry.def: Revenge involves hurting or punishing someone who has hurt or harmed you.

example.ex: The attackers were said to be taking revenge on the 14-year-old, claiming he was a school bully...
example.tran: 据说，这些攻击者是在报复这个14岁的孩子，说他是学校的小霸王。

example.ex: The killings were said to have been in revenge for the murder of her lover.
example.tran: 据说，她杀人是为了替她被害的情人报仇。

entry.def: If you revenge yourself on someone who has hurt you, you hurt them in return.

example.ex: The Sunday Mercury accused her of trying to revenge herself on her former lover...
example.tran: 《星期日信使报》指责她企图报复她以前的情人。

example.ex: ...the relatives of murdered villagers wanting to revenge the dead.
example.tran: 想要为死者报仇的被害村民的亲属

means.word_mean: 1. action taken in return for an injury or offense
1. take revenge for a perceived wrong;

sentences.sentence: "He wants to avenge the murder of his brother"

auth_sentence.content: They further stated they were on a revenge mission.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 复仇心重的, [利于]报复的
stems_affixes.word_buile: venge惩罚[引申为报仇]+ful充满……的→充满惩罚的心→复仇心重的
revenge[n.报复,复仇 v.替…报仇]+ful充满……的→adj.报复的,深藏仇恨的
re反+venge惩罚[引申为报仇]→反惩罚→报仇
venge惩罚[引申为报仇]+ance表名词→n.报复,报仇,复仇
a加强动作+venge惩罚[引申为报仇]→v.为…复仇,为…报仇
re反+venge惩罚[引申为报仇]→反惩罚→报仇

sentences.en: His heart burned with longing for revenge.
sentences.cn: 他心中燃烧着急欲复仇的怒火。

jushi.english: I'll have my revenge on you for this.
jushi.chinese: 这件事我会找你算账的。

jushi.english: They took a terrible revenge on the people of the village.
jushi.chinese: 他们对村民们进行了恐怖的报复。

jushi.english: He will wish to revenge his humiliation in last Season's Final.
jushi.chinese: 他会为在上个季度的决赛中所受的耻辱而报复的。
